de.wwu.muggl.symbolic.flow.controlflow
Class ControlGraph

java.lang.Object
  de.wwu.muggl.symbolic.flow.controlflow.ControlGraph

public class ControlGraph
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides a control graph for a method.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-08-28
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Field Detail

CG_INVOKED_METHOD

public static final int CG_INVOKED_METHOD
The magic number to mark an edge in the control graph denoting that the method was invoked. The predecessor of a node marked with this always is 0 i.e. the first instruction. This magic number should only be used by the def-use generator.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

CG_RETURN_METHOD

public static final int CG_RETURN_METHOD
The magic number to mark an edge in the control graph for returning from a method.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

CG_EXCECPTION_METHOD

public static final int CG_EXCECPTION_METHOD
The magic number to mark an edge in the control graph for leaving a method because an uncaugbht exception was thrown.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

ControlGraph

public ControlGraph(Method method)
             throws InvalidInstructionInitialisationException
Construct the control graph for a method.

Parameters:
method - The method to generate the control graph for.
Throws:
InvalidInstructionInitialisationException - On any fatal problems with the parsing and the initialization of instructions.
java.lang.NullPointerException - If the supplied Method is null.

getControlGraphFor

public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getControlGraphFor(int index)
Get the edges of the control graph for the instruction index.

Parameters:
index - The index into the instructions to get the edges for; or null, if the index in invalid.
Returns:
A set of edges of the control graph.

toString

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:

showEdges

public java.lang.String showEdges(boolean showInstructionMnemorics)
Get a more sophisticated String representation of the control graph edges. The output will be similar to this:
1
|
2
|
3 -> 5
|
4
|
5

Parameters:
showInstructionMnemorics - Do not only display the instructions positions but also their mnemonics.
Returns:
A more sophisticated String representation of the control graph edges.
See Also:
toString()

getUncaughtExceptionTypes

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getUncaughtExceptionTypes()
Get the exception types which are thrown but not caught by this method.

Returns:
The uncaught exception types of this method.

showUncaughtExceptionTypes

public java.lang.String showUncaughtExceptionTypes()
Show the exception types which are thrown but not caught by this method. The representation will be line by line, i.e. exceptions are separated by \n. The result will be ordered alphabetically.

Returns:
The uncaught exception types of this method.
